results.title: Typing skills: daily job techniques. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Illustrates that on-the-job proficiency requires adequate preparation for the day’s work, in addition to mastery of basic operating skills. Shows how a typist can eliminate needless movement and increase her output.

results.title: Typically British: Irish cinema: ourselves alone?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Century of cinema”.
Typically British. Directed by Mike Dibb and Stephen Frears, produced by Colin MacCabe. Francois Truffaut once observed that the words ‘British’ and ‘cinema’ seemed incompatable. In his celebration of 100 years of British Cinema, Stephen Frears shapes an elegant and witty riposte to this statement. In discussion with other British film-makers, Frears explores the wealth of stylish and familiar images created by the British film industry over the last century. “Irish Cinema: Ourselves alone”. Produced and directed by Donald Taylor Black. Narrated by Gabriel Byrne, this documentary looks at the struggle of Irish people to create an Irish cinema. Carefully intercutting interviews with directors, writers and producers with clips from feature films, location footage and fascinating archive material, Donald Taylor Black compares past and present in order to ask questions about the future of Irish cinema.

results.title: Types of criminal sanctions
results.creator_credit: Video Classroom, Geoff Russell and Peter Wiseman
results.brief_description: How do we punish criminals? Reveals the many dilemmas faced by our legal system in balancing society’s expectation for protection (and the punishment and rehabilitation of offenders) against the rights of the criminal in order to ultimately reach a ‘just’ outcome. What is a ‘just outcome’ for both the individual and the community? These and other key questions are explored through interviews with prisoners, County Court Judges and other legal interest groups. Explains and discusses the main types of criminal sanctions issued by most Australian courts: Admonishment, Fines, Community based Corrections, Imprisonment, other innovations, such as Home Detention and private prisons.

results.title: Type 2014K Image Orthicon camera
results.creator_credit: Films & Equipment Ltd., Vinten and PYE Ltd.
results.brief_description: Pye cameras were used across Australia in newsrooms and in the field by journalists at GTV9 and ABV2. They are lightweight and compact, making them easy to transport, and they feature an extended focus range switch for extreme close-ups.

constellations_primary.name: News on location
constellations_primary.description: The Pye Orthicon is an example of the type of television cameras used from the 1950s in Australia for both studio and outside broadcast work. Such cameras did not have have the capacity to record while out on location and so outside crews would transmit vision and sound back to studios for recording or live broadcast.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Films & Equipment Ltd., Vinten and PYE Ltd.
results.description:
In 1948, Australian audiences were introduced to television at the Sydney Royal Easter Show. The British electronics company Pye had brought its 405-line cameras and monitors to encourage interest in the new medium.

While it would be eight years until Bruce Gyngell famously welcomed Australia to television, the Pye company was still essential to the burgeoning industry.

Pye cameras like this were used across Australia in newsrooms and in the field by journalists at GTV9 and ABV2. They are lightweight and compact, making them easy to transport, and they feature an extended focus range switch for extreme close-ups.
description_for_label:

While it would be eight years until Bruce Gyngell famously welcomed Australia to television, the Pye company was still essential to the burgeoning industry.

Pye cameras like this were used across Australia in newsrooms and in the field by journalists at GTV9 and ABV2. They are lightweight and compact, making them easy to transport, and they feature an extended focus range switch for extreme close-ups.

results.title: Two/out [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Kriv Stenders, Pod Films and Catherine Kerr
results.brief_description:
Jack and Tom are cellmates with a tenuous friendship. Their fragile bond begins to unravel when Jack develops dementia, and Tom, unable to understand Jack’s condition forces them into a physical confrontation which challenges the nature of their relationship.
Utilising only one shot and a series of dissolves and jump cuts, this powerful short film examines the relationship between two men who share a single gaol cell. When the subject of the lack of the female object emerges, the tiny space they inhabit erupts into violence and frustrated desire.

results.title: Two years or more
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Marc Beaudet, Gilles Therien and Georges Dufaux
results.brief_description: An inside look at a modern federal penal institution of the kind built during the past decade, showing improvements that have been made not only in the physical facilities for housing inmates but also in the treatment and training programs. Emphasis is now placed on rehabilitation of the individual rather than on punishment for his crime.
